revised_title: The Prehensores of Male Butterflies: A Study of the Genera Ornithoptera and Papilio
tldr: This article examines the prehensores, or male reproductive organs, of butterflies in the genera Ornithoptera and Papilio. The author provides detailed descriptions and illustrations of the organs, including the valve, harpe, uncus, scaphium, and penis, and discusses their functions in seizing and holding the female during mating.
